column36: Heathcliff looks a safer bet for Fanshawe fans; non-runner
column37: Failed to beat a rival last time, when trying to win the same Wolverhampton contest he took in 2024; was observed coughing post race and he's had a break since; cheekpieces discarded; Heathcliff looks a safer bet for Fanshawe fans; non-runner.

column4: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts (London Sprint Series Qual) Handicap

column36: Major claims if building on pleasing stable debut back sprinting from handy draw
column37: Recorded clear personal best on final start for Kevin Philippart De Foy in June (won over 6f at Windsor); reappeared over 7f at Wolverhampton last month and managed third despite drifting to 16-1; major claims if building on that back sprinting from handy draw.

column4: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts (London Sprint Series Qual) Handicap

column32: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
column36: Has done nothing wrong so far and will rightly be popular
column37: Landed hat-trick in 3yo final at Newcastle on Good Friday, his first foray into handicaps; ran as well as could be expected in Listed race/Group 1 before returning from 159 days off to be a close second at Southwell three weeks ago (had two of these in behind; personal best); key player from a good draw.

column4: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts (London Sprint Series Qual) Handicap

column36: Looked rusty when behind two of these on AW debut but rather watch
column37: Emphatic win in valuable sales race at the Curragh last September was unexpected on form but he backed it up when third in Listed company at York next time; both handicap runs came off breaks of over six months and he certainly looked rusty when behind two of these on AW debut at Southwell three weeks ago; rather watch.

column36: Made it 3-3 over C&D and 3-3 under Robert Havlin when beating Heathcliff six weeks ago
column37: Made it 3-3 over C&D and 3-3 under Robert Havlin when beating Heathcliff by a cosy neck six weeks ago; obvious claims off 2lb higher.

column36: Could be highly competitive if not hassled at the head of affairs
column37: Front-runner/prominent racer; C&D winner last year and struck over this trip at Leicester and York in 2025; seemed to go a stride too quick when fifth at Southwell three weeks ago and could be more competitive tonight if not hassled at the head of affairs; Roger Teal landed this with Chipstead in 2023.

column4: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts (London Sprint Series Qual) Handicap

column36: Not so effective last two starts and needs a spark back on AW

column36: Can only watch given absence and new variables

column36: Solid option given course form; closely matched with Coul Angel on latest running
column37: Third-best RPR when just giving best to Coul Angel over C&D six weeks ago and his top two figures were achieved at this venue; solid option.

column4: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts (London Sprint Series Qual) Handicap

column36: 0-8 in Britain/for Ian Williams but managed second three times; could be poised to strike
column37: 0-8 in Britain/for Ian Williams but managed second three times, including in the Coral Sprint Trophy at York two runs ago; Wolverhampton run last week wasn't bad and might have put him spot on for this.

column4: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts (London Sprint Series Qual) Handicap
column20: 3/1 Berkshire Whisper, 9/2 So Darn Hot, 5/1 Coul Angel, 6/1 Heathcliff, 10/1 Hucklesbrook,  Purest Time, 12/1 Bolo Neighs, 14/1 Willem Twee,  El Bodon, 16/1 Media Shooter, 20/1 Granger Bay
column36: Has joined James Owen but was trained by another top operator in Karl Burke before
column37: Dual C&D winner last year and signed off early in August with a clear personal best at Musselburgh (won by nearly 3l); reappeared at Newcastle in May and weakened right out of it after pulling hard; not seen since and has left Karl Burke; market informative; goes without cheekpieces.

column4: Unibet Wild Flower Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 6/4 Dubai Honour, 2/1 Shader,  Ancient Wisdom, 25/1 Claymore, 200/1 Lion City
column32: Exors of the late Mohamed Obaida
column36: Sound claims if this pans out as favourably as last time
column37: Four wins at the very top level in Australia and France and meets Shader on the same terms as when beating him by a length at Southwell 19 days ago; sound claims if this pans out as favourably.

column4: Unibet Wild Flower Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 6/4 Dubai Honour, 2/1 Shader,  Ancient Wisdom, 25/1 Claymore, 200/1 Lion City
column36: Not sure he enjoyed making the running when beaten a length by Dubai Honour last time
column37: Highly progressive and when he wins he wins in style, most recent example when storming clear of five rivals in C&D Listed contest last month; again heavily backed but perhaps didn't enjoy making the running when beaten a length by Dubai Honour at Southwell last time; same terms here.

column4: Unibet Wild Flower Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 6/4 Dubai Honour, 2/1 Shader,  Ancient Wisdom, 25/1 Claymore, 200/1 Lion City
column36: Group 1 winner at two but is unpenalised here; fascinating contender on AW debut
column37: Group 1 winner at two but, unlike Dubai Honour and Shader, he's unpenalised thanks to finishing second rather than first in Group/Listed company since the end of March; major form claims and he's a fascinating contender tackling AW for the first time (his brother and half-brother both won on it); trainer won this with Rebel's Romance in 2023.

column4: Unibet Wild Flower Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 6/4 Dubai Honour, 2/1 Shader,  Ancient Wisdom, 25/1 Claymore, 200/1 Lion City

column32: Jb Harper And Cavalry And Guards
column36: Raised 3lb for his Huntingdon defeat but was clear of the rest behind an improver
column37: Won small-field chases at Market Rasen (2m1f, good to soft) and here (2m, good) in March; possibly bettered that form on his return from a break at Huntingdon when the clear second behind an improver; up 3lb but enters the reckoning; can lead but doesn't have to.

column4: Tanners Champagne Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Homme d'Un Soir,  Authoceltic,  Lightning Flash, 5/1 Hypotenus, 11/2 Milan Tino, 6/1 Lime Drop, 10/1 Paddy In The Caddy, 33/1 Park Annonciade, 50/1 Stormin Crossgales
column36: Last win came in a two-runner claiming chase; pulled up in both races for current yard
column37: Won a two-runner claiming chase for previous yard; then changed hands for £5,000 and has pulled up in two handicap chases for this one.

column4: Tanners Champagne Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Homme d'Un Soir,  Authoceltic,  Lightning Flash, 5/1 Hypotenus, 11/2 Milan Tino, 6/1 Lime Drop, 10/1 Paddy In The Caddy, 33/1 Park Annonciade, 50/1 Stormin Crossgales
column36: Useful hurdler before losing his way; didn't jump great when well beaten on chase debut
column37: Much better than a typical nine-race maiden hurdler as he often ran well behind smart opposition, and he did go off favourite for the Fred Winter at Cheltenham two seasons back; below best when fourth in a novice hurdle on return and his jumping lacked conviction on chase debut at Warwick (2m4f, good; beaten 33l); ability is respected but some reservations for now.

column4: Tanners Champagne Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Homme d'Un Soir,  Authoceltic,  Lightning Flash, 5/1 Hypotenus, 11/2 Milan Tino, 6/1 Lime Drop, 10/1 Paddy In The Caddy, 33/1 Park Annonciade, 50/1 Stormin Crossgales
column36: Did well last season and her Uttoxeter fourth was fair enough given the heavy ground
column37: Won three small-field chases last season on good ground or good to soft; on a high mark but ran okay last time at Uttoxeter given the ground was heavy and conditions won't be so taxing here; has a chance.

column4: Tanners Champagne Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Homme d'Un Soir,  Authoceltic,  Lightning Flash, 5/1 Hypotenus, 11/2 Milan Tino, 6/1 Lime Drop, 10/1 Paddy In The Caddy, 33/1 Park Annonciade, 50/1 Stormin Crossgales
column36: Second here 23 days ago; same mark for this but in what's probably a better race
column37: Three Flat wins in France and added an Irish maiden hurdle more than two years ago; 0-9 as a chaser but this front-runner gave it a good go over C&D three weeks ago (good); same mark here but in what's probably a better race.

column4: Tanners Champagne Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column37: Maiden hurdler but already looking a better chaser after two attempts, last time justifying favouritism by nearly 4l at Wincanton (1m7f, good; 6lb lower); hasn't excelled himself in previous runs on softer ground but could be a better horse now.

column4: Tanners Champagne Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: Running well and upsides Hypotenus when falling two out over C&D last month
column37: His defeat of subsequent winner Pure Carbon on his chase debut at Chepstow in October reads well; poor next time but he was running fine and upsides Hypotenus when falling two out over C&D last month; should have every chance if getting round with no dramas.

column4: Tanners Champagne Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: Figures PFF3 in chases; quiet in two handicap hurdles for current yard
column37: Form figures of PFF3 in previous chase attempts and hasn't offered a lot in two handicap hurdle for current yard; risky.

column4: Shuker Build EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' NH Novices' Hurdle Qual') (GBB)

column37: Beat Haiti Couleurs on his chase debut last season when 4lb lower (2m7f, good to soft); mostly ran well afterwards and shaped as though his Chepstow run in October would bring him on; the ground was also good to firm and these conditions will suit better.

column4: Tanners Claret Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Destroytheevidence,  Hunter Legend, 7/2 Neon Moon, 4/1 Ballycamus, 11/2 Rockinastorm, 14/1 Rapper

column37: Stayed on best to lead late on over 2m5f at Ascot (good; handles softer) last month and most of his chase form has been at about this far; very capable of defying a 3lb rise if he can hold his form, which isn't always the case.

column4: Tanners Claret Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Destroytheevidence,  Hunter Legend, 7/2 Neon Moon, 4/1 Ballycamus, 11/2 Rockinastorm, 14/1 Rapper

column37: Strike-rate of 5-13 over fences and ran as well as ever when sixth in the Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham in November (2m4f, soft; staying on); ran no race at Newbury (2m6f, good to soft) but that was a rare blip and the possibility of softer ground here would benefit; stable showing signs of striking some form as well.

column4: Tanners Claret Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Destroytheevidence,  Hunter Legend, 7/2 Neon Moon, 4/1 Ballycamus, 11/2 Rockinastorm, 14/1 Rapper

column37: Potentially well handicapped but last season's thirds were remote and he was pulled up in a Class 2 at Ascot on his return; changes headgear this afternoon but turns 12 soon and has too much to prove.

column4: Tanners Claret Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column37: Started this season with two respectable runs before a disappointing show at Cheltenham a month ago when heavy ground was no excuse; could easily return to form with Sam Twiston-Davies back aboard and he's a C&D winner.

column37: Won here (good) and at Wetherby (soft) last season and still on a competitive mark; held when falling late on at Cheltenham in October but could be a very different proposition this time.

column37: Ended 2024 with wide-margin Irish point win and is 2-2 under rules this year, the latter win gained on seasonal/hurdle debut at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) in October; penalised in a better race here but it's very hard to gauge the limit of his ability.

column37: Looked quite promising in bumpers but showed only minor promise and was ultimately well beaten on first two hurdling starts (both 2m3f).

column36: Won Carlisle bumper in February but first two hurdle runs were very underwhelming
column37: Won soft-ground Carlisle bumper in February but both 2m hurdle runs last month were very underwhelming; moves up in trip here.

column36: Won on Irish point debut in October; market instructive before this rules debut
column37: Brother to useful hurdler Hartington and half-brother to two fairly useful Flat racers; dam unraced half-sister to smart Flat/hurdle winner I'm Supposin; made winning Irish point debut in October (yielding to soft) and good market support will make him of strong interest on this rules debut.

column37: Useful hurdler (front-runner) who won a match race on chasing debut last November and was a very respectable third in Cheltenham Grade 2 (2m, good) later that month; returned to hurdling with game effort in defeat in October, after a layoff, and could take some catching if he gets into a good rhythm.

column37: Bettered low-key seasonal debut when creditable fifth in valuable Ascot handicap (2m1f, good to soft) last month; runs that track well and may not be seen to quite the same effect here but still enters calculations in this easier race; sports first-time cheekpieces.

column4: JM Finn Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column37: Versatile 5yo who won on the Flat during the summer and belied 50-1 odds when keeping on well for creditable C&D (good to soft) second on last month's chasing debut; obvious contender if in similar form again.

column4: JM Finn Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: Out of form form new stable this autumn
column37: Very well handicapped on old front-running form for Willie Mullins but has looked out of sorts on all three starts for new stable this autumn (held up in rear); might benefit from a return to more positives tactics but has much more to prove than the others in this line-up.

column4: JM Finn Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column27: S A S I E I & Percy Holding Aps

column37: Took well to fences last season (two wins) and returned from break with two seconds this autumn, latterly when losing out only by a neck at Cheltenham (2m, soft); has to take recent 4lb rise on the chin but can make his presence felt again here.

column4: JM Finn Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column20: 5/2 Torneo, 9/4 Highlands Legacy, 4/1 Lookaway,  Mighty Bandit, 9/1 Kotmask, 20/1 Uncle Phil

column37: Came from the rear to make winning chase debut at Worcester (2m, good) in October and bettered that performance when close second at Aintree (2m, good to soft; form working out very well) last month; probably still well handicapped after latest 3lb rise; good chance.

column37: Irish raider who kept on well for close third on last month's handicap chase debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft); not yet fully exposed over fences and features prominently in calculations here.

column37: Easily won three-runner C&D (good) contest on last month's seasonal debut (first run after wind op) and subsquent third of four at Ascot (2m5f, good) was perfectly respectable; big player if first-time blinkers have any positive effect.

column4: BetVictor Wishes You A Merry Christmas Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 7/2 Knight Of Allen, 100/30 Road To Home, 5/1 Fine Casting, 7/1 Lord Baddesley,  Peso, 10/1 Don't Tell Su, 12/1 Walking On Air,  Icare Grandchamp, 14/1 Aviation
column36: Absent since April and hard to predict but unlucky not to win major handicap in January
column37: Mostly out of form for Gary Brown last season and absent since pulled up in Scottish National on stable debut in April; however, held narrow lead before last-fence fall in Great Yorkshire Chase at Doncaster (3m, good) in January and remains very well treated on old form for Nicky Henderson.

column4: BetVictor Wishes You A Merry Christmas Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column37: Very unexposed 6yo who comfortably won a 2m novice hurdle here (good to soft) just under a year ago; makes handicap/chase debut after 328-day absence but his promising Irish point debut in 2023 bodes well for his prospects over fences; market may guide.

column4: BetVictor Wishes You A Merry Christmas Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 7/2 Knight Of Allen, 100/30 Road To Home, 5/1 Fine Casting, 7/1 Lord Baddesley,  Peso, 10/1 Don't Tell Su, 12/1 Walking On Air,  Icare Grandchamp, 14/1 Aviation

column37: Drew a blank over hurdles last season but returned to chasing with win at Bangor (2m4f, soft) last month, after a break, and is still on a workable mark after recent 6lb rise.

column4: BetVictor Wishes You A Merry Christmas Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: 2-7 over hurdles; flattered by proximity when second on chase debut but can improve
column37: 2-7 over hurdles; third best on merit and flattered by proximity when second in two-finisher Chepstow novice chase (2m7f, good to firm) on seasonal debut in October but significant positives can still be drawn from that performance and he's open to improvement over fences.

column36: Consistent over hurdles for Paul Nicholls; absent since underwhelming chase debut in March
column37: Largely consistent over hurdles for Paul Nicholls; absent since underwhelming chase debut in March but makes debut for Nicky Henderson (same owners) from a workable mark and with trip/ground suitable.

column36: Well beaten on last month's seasonal/chase debut but might have needed the run
column37: Fair novice hurdler last season; well beaten on last month's seasonal/chase debut at Lingfield (2m4f, good; first-time cheekpieces) but might have needed that recent outing and still has potential over fences.

column4: BetVictor Wishes You A Merry Christmas Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: 2-5 over fences; absent 13 months since winning in 0-110 grade; tough task on return
column37: 2-5 over fences; may still have more improvement to come but absent since winninng 0-110 contest at Southwell (2m4f, good) 13 months ago and will need to hit the ground running to have any chance in this grade.

column37: Her dam won on the Flat and she won on debut at Stratford (2m, good to soft) in October when a 9-1 shot; now carries a 7lb penalty against some interesting opponents but her form reads well and she's a key player.

column4: Celebrating Chris Wood's 80th Birthday Fillies' "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

column4: Celebrating Chris Wood's 80th Birthday Fillies' "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

column4: Celebrating Chris Wood's 80th Birthday Fillies' "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

column37: Second foal; sister to bumper winner Ronnie Russet (RPR 94); dam bumper winner (118) from useful family; no surprise to see a good run on debut.

column37: 9-1, showed ability when fifth of eight on last month's debut at Huntingdon (2m, good); this half-sister to five Flat winners is open to improvement but she has something to find with Huntingdon runner-up Saxons Pride.
